thread.title: Defensive lineman Daviyon Nixon signed with Iowa today. Afte
thread.title_full: Defensive lineman Daviyon Nixon signed with Iowa today. Afte

author: rivals.com
title: Defensive lineman Daviyon Nixon signed with Iowa today. Afte
text:
Defensive lineman Daviyon Nixon signed with Iowa today. After making an official visit to Iowa this past weekend, Wisconsin defensive lineman Daviyon Nixon signed with the Hawkeyes today. The 6-foot-4, 285-pound Nixon was announced among the signees by the Iowa football program this morning.
Welcome to the Swarm, DL Daviyon Nixon | #Swarm17
https://t.co/fzJrd2ymfB
— Hawkeye Football (@HawkeyeFootball) February 1, 2017 Formerly a Northern Illinois commit, Nixon reopened his recruiting after adding offers from Iowa and Purdue in January and visited both Big Ten programs. In Iowa City this past weekend, the three-star prospect told us he felt at home.
“I liked it a lot,” said Nixon. “The players made it like a family environment as well as the coaches.”
“I really liked all the people there and the fact that they had detailed information on what I want to study, criminal justice," he continued.
Overall, Nixon is commitment No. 21 for the Iowa Hawkeyes in the Class of 2017.
See highlights from Nixon's senior year at Kenosha Indian Trail in the video below.
